page.title: 14CHURCHES
page.content: {PARISH CHURCHES}The Medieval Parish churches in Skeffling and Easington are built on a traditional vernacular cruciform style.The fabric materials are mainly of beach cobbles (rounded stones), Tadcaster stone brought down by barges to the river shore,and old hand made bricks. { IN SKEFFLING}there is only one church which has recently been renovated.It is called St.Helens and it looks fresh and sparkling.There is no electricity in the church. In Easington there is the Parish Church of All Saints ,a derelict Primitive Methodist Chapel (1851) and a Wesleyan Chapel(1850) which is still in use. {ALL SAINTS EASINGTON}was built in the 12th Century but the Saxons probably had a church on this site. Easington,and Skeffling share a vicar.
